definition: having an important effect on a large part of something
too general and failing to think about or understand particular examples
a victory by a large number of votes, etc.
forming a curved shape
a flat piece of metal, usually like a coin in shape, that is given to the winner of a competition or to somebody who has been brave, for example in war
used to say that you admire somebody because they have done something difficult or unpleasant
the lining of a cow’s or pig’s stomach, eaten as food
something that somebody says or writes that you think is silly or not true, or not of good quality
principles relating to right and wrong or good and bad behaviour
the degree to which something is right or wrong, good or bad, etc. according to moral principles
a system of moral principles followed by a particular group of people
a hard stone with bands or areas of colour, used in jewellery
with no people living there; not inhabited
empty, with nobody living there or using it
not controlled by foreign soldiers
a person who admires somebody/something, especially a well-known person or thing
a person who has a romantic or sexual interest in somebody
a substance like jelly, used by scientists for growing cultures, and to make liquid foods thicker
a doctor who studies the use of anesthetics
the fact of being unable to read or write
the fact of knowing very little about a particular subject area
an area of extreme swelling on the wall of an artery
a thing or an event that exists or comes before another, and may have influenced it
the people in somebody’s family who lived a long time ago
a word or phrase to which the following word, especially a pronoun, refers
a plant with leaves that have a strong taste and are used in cooking as a herb
the belief in and process of increasing the size and importance of something, especially in a country or a business

a part of a rugby game when players from both sides link themselves together in a group, with their heads down, and push against the other side. The ball is then thrown between them and each side tries to get it.
the group of players who link themselves together in a scrum
a crowd of people who are pushing each other
including everything possible; very careful or complete
done completely; with great attention to detail
doing things very carefully and with great attention to detail
used to emphasize how bad or annoying somebody/something is
the act of removing dead cells from the surface of skin in order to make it smoother
the act of removing something completely from something; the thing removed
the detailed explanation of a piece of writing, especially religious writing
in a happy and enthusiastic way
becoming old-fashioned and no longer useful
to be a typical example of something
to give an example in order to make something clearer
to a much greater level or degree than seems reasonable or appropriate
the quality of being extremely good
a person who is being tested to see how much they know about a subject or what they can do; a person who is taking an exam
when a woman breastfeeds, she feeds her baby with milk from her breasts
the art of writing by hand; skill in doing this
a formal written, spoken or practical test, especially at school or college, to see how much you know about a subject, or what you can do
a medical test of a particular part of the body
an act of demanding and getting something from somebody
an act of making something bad happen to somebody
to bring bad luck in a mysterious way
a person or thing that brings or causes bad luck
to remove something that has been written or printed, or that has been stored on a computer
a person who tries to persuade people to become Christians, especially by travelling around the country holding religious meetings or speaking on radio or television
one of the four writers (Matthew, Mark, Luke, John) of the books called the gospels in the Bible
a person who enthusiastically tries to persuade people to believe in something, appreciate something, etc.
to escape from somebody/something or avoid meeting somebody
to find a way of not doing something, especially something that legally or morally you should do
to avoid dealing with or talking about something
to not come or happen to somebody
great interest and excitement about something that is going to happen or about something that you want to do
the quality of being enthusiastic or wanting something very much
the strength or depth of a feeling
the quality of understanding well or quickly
the quality of competing very hard for something
the state of being ready or prepared for something
the state of being willing to do something
an object or objects made of very hard baked clay
having folds or lines because of age, worry, etc.
having lines printed or drawn across it
having a lining inside them
having the object mentioned along an edge or edges, or as a lining
in a way connected with the trade, industry and development of wealth of a country, an area or a society
in a way that provides good service or value in relation to the amount of time or money spent
in a way that uses no more of something than is necessary
a cold Spanish soup made with tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers, etc.
a public performance of music or poetry, usually given by one person or a small group
a spoken description of a series of events, etc. that is often long and boring
